page.title: 02A DAY FOR A WOMAN IN CURY
page.content: I get up at six thirty in the morning. I have a wash, clean my teeth and get dressed. Then I feed the chickens. After I get breakfast for the family, which is myself,my husband and three children. I have five beds to make. Once a week I clean the windows. At about eleven forty five I start preparing the midday lunch. After lunch I wash the dishes. The children help in drying them and putting them away. I might go shopping at the local shop once a week. We do not have a radio, but we watch television at lunchtimes and at five o clock for the news. At six thirty in the evening we milk the cows. Later we read a book or the newspapers,while the children play. The children do not do much on the farm yet. They go up to bed at six or seven o clock. My husband and I go up at ten o clock.
